titleStmt.title: Oliver D. Greene to James F. Robinson
CWG12178

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 1st - 20th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Primary Source Documents

body.p:
19th
Adjutant General's Office,
Washington, August 10th 1863.
To His Excellency,
The Governor of Kentucky
Sir:

I have the honor to report, that the following named Officers of the Volunteer forces from the State of Kentucky haves resigned, to take effect at the dates set opposite their ^his^ respective names, viz:
âœ“ First Lieut George Rose 19 Regt July 5. 1863

I am Sir
Very respectfully
Your Obt Servant
O D Greene
Asst Adjt General.

No 120
Washington City
Letter
Resigs.
Filed Sept. 1 1863
